Dialogue: Like I said, don't deal bikes. I'll give you four-twenty. Cash. Best I can do.

Dialogue: "Into the street the Piper stept, smiling first a little smile, then three shrill notes the pipe uttered like a great and mighty army muttered..."

Dialogue: Lil' bit.

Speaker: contractor
Dialogue: Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Billy.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yep.

Dialogue: Looks like ya made it through pretty good.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We're alright.

Dialogue: Damn twister touched down eight places between here and Noblesville. Chewed up six hundred homes in Fulton County alone.  Got all the work you can handle if you're interested.

Dialogue: I'm interested...

Dialogue: 60/40 til you pay me back on the tools. Then we'll go half.

Dialogue: You got a deal.

Dialogue: What are you doin, Sam Childers?

Dialogue: I wanna peek.

Dialogue: Keep em closed.

Dialogue: Where are we?

Dialogue: That's ours? 23

Dialogue: Sure is. Go check it out.

Dialogue: It's beautiful.

Dialogue: That's everything.

Dialogue: You get what's in the trunk?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yep.

Dialogue: Lord, you're filthy, Sam Childers.

Speaker: sam

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You.

Dialogue: You dirtier than I am.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: No I ain't.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yes you are. I seen it. C'mon, girl, gimme a little shake... 24

Dialogue: I ain't doin that no more.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... just a little somethin for yer old man, c'mon...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You gimme a little shake...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: C'mon, Lynn...

Speaker: pastor krause
Dialogue: Today we are blessed with a special guest. It's my pleasure to welcome Pastor Relling from the Kilangire Christian Ministry in Uganda, Africa. Pastor...

Speaker: relling
Dialogue: Thank you Pastor Krause, and thank you brothers and sisters for inviting me into this house of the Lord.  I'm here today to talk to you about your Christian brothers and sisters, families just like yours, a half a world away that desperately need your help...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Paige, go get some more beans.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thinking about Africa.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: They have tigers over there?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They eat people!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: What about Africa?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Just thinkin bout that fella today.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: He talked funny.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Just from a different place than us, baby, that's all.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Was thinkin maybe I'd go over there. Help em out fer a few weeks. 26

Speaker: daisy
Dialogue: Africa?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: To see the tigers.

Dialogue: He was talkin about puttin box beam roofs on school houses over there.

Dialogue: What about finishing that job in Boswell?

Dialogue: I'll only be gone a few weeks. Be back before you know it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You Ugandan Army or what?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: SPLA.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sudanese People's Liberation Army. We are freedom fighters.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Name's Sam Childers.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I am Deng.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Givin ya problems?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Yes. A bit.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Double-feed?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sometimes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Lemme have a look...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Are you military?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No, not me. I ain't the military type. Ain't so good with bein told what to do.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: When did you learn about weapons?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Long time ago. Different life.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: Some of us are going into Kampala tomorrow night. Find ourselves a little fun this weekend. You in?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I was thinkin bout goin up north.

Speaker: dan
Dialogue: You crazy? There's a civil war going on up there.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hey, Deng, you wanna Coke?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Got a question for ya.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I wanna go into Sudan this weekend. Need someone to show me around. You interested?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: The others are going into Kampala. 29

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That ain't my speed no more. I wanna see some country.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: You want to see?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They always drive this fast?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Traveling is the most dangerous time in Sudan. If the rebels find you on the open road it would be very bad.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You got kids, Deng?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: No. I have no children.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Where you from?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: A little village called Aweil. Many hours from here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's where your family is?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: My family was killed by LRA.  Unyama is about two hours from here. We will stop there for lunch. 30

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: The Muslim North has tried to kill the Christian South for 30 years. Two million have lost their lives...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Cholera and Malaria are everywhere, there is little food and not enough UN soldiers to protect everyone. Even here they worry the LRA will attack at night.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Sam... I'll be five minutes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Course, do what you gotta do.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: Excuse me. You. Can you help please?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What happened to her face?

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: The rebels cut off her lips because she argued. These are Kony's orders.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Who's Kony?

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: Who are you with?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm with Deng over there. 32

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: What organization are you with?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Working with a Christian group down South. Just up here takin a look around, seein a bit of the country.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: This isn't a tourist destination, this is a war zone. You stay in this area, you'll be killed.  Thank you for your help.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Some say Joseph Kony is a wizard. A shapeshifter. He calls himself a Christian...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Kony is the leader of the LRA?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: He is the one we have been fighting for years. But there is very little we can do. Our weapons are old, and our boots are full of holes. We have been forgotten by the rest of the world.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: S'cuse me?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: What are you looking for in this place?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ain't lookin for nuthin.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: And then you will get your picture and go back to your life and all this will just be a story you tell your friends.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: They are night commuters. They come from deep in the bush. Their parents send them out because it is safer to sleep here than in their own homes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Because death comes at night in the villages and refugee camps.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Get up... let's go...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They ain't sleepin out here. Tell em they're comin inside.  Ya'll get up... let's go...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam, there are too many...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I can help these here. 35

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Settle down... it's alright... you can sleep here till morning...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: The LRA attacked a village last night.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You see any tigers over there?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Naw, didn't see no tigers.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: But they do have them over in Africa.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: So I hear, but not where I was.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Sure am glad you're home.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Me too, bug.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: I'm thinkin of a plane...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's late, you better get to bed...

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: C'mon, plane... I'm thinkin of a plane...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You said plane, I'm thinkin of a train...

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You said train, I'm thinkin of a brain.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You said brain, I'm thinkin of a...

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Gotcha!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ok, you got me.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You coulda said drain, or mane... like horse's hair.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sweet dreams, bug.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You comin to bed?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: In a bit

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You ok?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Just a long flight.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Baby, whatcha doin?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Makin plans.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You been to bed yet?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I had a vision last night, Lynn. Crazy as it sounds, God spoke to me...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: A church? 40

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Right across the street. Not like Faith United or Calvary Fellowship. Place that ain't gonna turn you away if you a drug addict or a prostitute or whatever. Place for sinners, just like me, who wanna hear the word of God.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: How we gonna pay for a church, Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We got money in the bank. Business is good. Besides, I own a construction company...  I'm gonna give us one heck of a good deal on the build.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Yer crazy.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: `Lil bit.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's the orphanage I wanna build. In Sudan.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's me.

Dialogue: Hey bro, Ben Hobbes, knew each other long time ago.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah, Ben, how you doin?

Speaker: daughter
Dialogue: Daddy, I'm gonna go.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: OK, sweetie...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sure do.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: Hey, nuthin fer nuthin, Sam, but rumor has it you was puttin up a chapel over there in Central City.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's right. Gonna minister to anybody who's lookin for The Lord.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: That's good, man. Maybe you can do somethin bout your old friend, Donnie.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What about em?

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: He ain't doin so good, bro. But hey, good seein ya' man. 42

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm here for that boy right there. You gonna get in the way a that?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: I can't do this.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Look at me. God don't make trash, boy. Now he ain't givin up on you, so don't give up on him, you hear me?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Welcome to Shekinah Fellowship Church.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: It's five-til and he still ain't here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You call him?  Try him again.

Speaker: daisy
Dialogue: You like this dress, Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What, mom? 44

Speaker: daisy
Dialogue: You ain't never seen this one. I bought it a long time ago. Been keepin it for a special occasion.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's nice.

Speaker: daisy
Dialogue: I never told you this but when I was pregnant with you, now this was way back, probably 1960, when yer daddy and I was still in Grand Rapids, a Pastor prophesied over me. Pulled me right up on stage and laid his hands on my belly and told me I was gonna have a Preacher for a son.  Yer daddy and I were so proud. I remember we went home and neither of us could sleep all night. Just laid there and talked bout you, bout what was comin.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I just built a church. I ain't no preacher.

Speaker: daisy
Dialogue: Yes you are. You were born to it. Just took you a little ways to get here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thank you, Tommy. You boys is soundin pretty good up here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Be back soon as I can.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You're gonna miss my play.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Have momma videotape it for me, k? Now I gotta git.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Call us when you can.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I will.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: That's done, buddy.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: You came all this way to bring us new boots?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Right here, stop the truck!

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam, wait...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: This is it...

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: This is not a good idea.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I think it's a heckuva good idea.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: It would be better further south. Closer to Kampala.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: If I wanted to be closer to Kampala, I'd be closer to Kampala. I wanna be right here...

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: He should not be this far north.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What are you sayin?

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: The villages in this area are very remote, Mr. Childers. There is nothing there.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Then it seems to me them people need help the most.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: He will be killed.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Talk to me.

Speaker: administrator
Dialogue: This is in the war zone, Mr. Childers. The LRA will kill you here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't think you understand me, so lemme make it real clear to ya. I didn't pick this land -- God did.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam... this is Betty. She is from the village of Kotido. A few miles from here. 49

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Good to meet you Betty.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: She is knowing that you need someone to run the orphanage.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm lookin for somebody who can keep the place in order. Make sure things is taken care of when I'm away.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: She can do this.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: She's gonna have to take care of the children too, make sure they're fed, fix em when they're sick. Can she do that?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Quiet now.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Tell her she's hired.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: You two share a blanket and tomorrow we will find another.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Shhhh, it's time to shut your eyes...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You know what's funny? In English your name means "darn it."

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: What is this `darn it?'

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Deng. It means `shucks.' You know, like you stub your toe and you go "ahhhhh, deng!" Get it?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Your name proceeds you wherever you go. You are Sam. This is how you are known. In my language this means something.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm sorry, buddy. It was just a joke.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Small penis.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Can I ask you a question?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You believe in God?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I was raised to believe there was a God in heaven.  But it is impossible to live here, to see what I have seen, and not turn your back on him.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Maybe you'll invite him in again one day.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How many are there?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Two squads...  There -- and there.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Where are your men?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They're gonna pick us off like this!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Stay down! -- stay down! --

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: We are protected! --

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: -- Betty! Get em to the church right now!  Understand?! --

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Get yer men back to the church! That's our best shot! I'll cover you...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: To the church! --

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Put em in the middle!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Down here! -- in the center! -- all of you! -- stay down!

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Four on the right!

Speaker: nineteen
Dialogue: There are too many!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Just keep firin!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's me.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You ok?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: They burned it to the ground. All of it. Ain't nuthin left.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Where are you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Nimule...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I can hear you.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Then quit feelin sorry for yerself. Them children have had their whole lives burned to the ground and worse. How many of them you see givin up?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Cut it all down... so they got nowhere to hide...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: All the way around...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Come on in...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Preacher, you need to come see this.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's goin on?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: The Acholi people were farmers before they were driven from their ancestral homeland. Each year they blessed the soil before a planting.

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: The children are your fields...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: ... she says you are a farmer and these children are your crops... 59

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: ... and this ground will grow them tall.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: ... and this ground is richer now and they will grow stronger because of it.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What is she saying?

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: She is asking what she did wrong?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Tell her she's gonna be ok.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Where did they find em?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Their village was hit out Adjumani.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Adjumani.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Sam, please wait...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I ain't waitin. You wanna see what waitin gets ya? Take a look in that buildin over there...

Speaker: william
Dialogue: It's the white preacher!

Speaker: adult rebel
Dialogue: STAND UP AND FIGHT!!!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No shot! There are children behind the truck!

Speaker: adult rebel
Dialogue: Fight you cowards!!!

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Why don't you just go home?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: This is not your war.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You leavin?

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Have you seen my brother?

Speaker: william
Dialogue: ... Where are you from?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Jabal.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Were you with the rebels?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: I am William. Were you with the rebels? 65

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Mornin, buddy.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Looks like you've got yourself a bodyguard.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Guess I do.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I will, Preacher.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You can't come with me, buddy.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Get out of there.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... he's not interested in your good thoughts... your good intentions... he wants your hands... your backs... your sweat... your blood to pour into the foundation that will build up his kingdom!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We started daycare last month. Monday thru Friday from 8 to 2... Sundays after first worship for a few hours if anybody needs it. How you doin, Sue?

Speaker: volunteer
Dialogue: Good. Hey Pastor.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sue.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We can't build anymore. Not for awhile.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You said Sundays has been full.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Turn outs been good, but that don't mean people is givin money.  Economy is in trouble, construction business is slow. Times is tight.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Be good for them kids, Lynn.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: They got the playground over in Cairnbrook. And they can play at the school on weekends if they want

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Not talking bout here. Talkin about the orphange.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: What'cha workin on, buddy?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Trouble with the push rods I think. She's runnin kinda rough.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Shoulda kept that mild in there `stead a buildin up a hot rod. Let's see whatcha got here...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Used to fix them old shovelheads on the side of the road with a buckknife and a wire hanger.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Remember that year we went to the Freakers Ball?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I think that old `78 broke down five times on that trip. 69

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Sounds about right. Shoot, we had more fun tryin to get there than when we finally did.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: I'm glad I'm walkin with the Lord and all, but sometimes I ain't sure I'm gonna be able to do what he wants me to do.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: The Lord don't ask for nuthin you can't deliver, buddy. And yer one tough ole boy.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Sometimes I ain't so sure how tough I am.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Why don't we pray together then...

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: ... from what I heard, you built yourself one helluva church over there in Central City. 70

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Still got a ways to go, but we're gettin there. You should come on by one of these Sundays, bring the family.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: That's nice of you, but we're at Calvary now. Bit more our speed over there I think.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Reverand Carlton gives a mean sermon, puts me to shame. Anyway Bill, I'm here cause I wanna talk to you about what we're doin over there in Africa.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Course I know about what you're doin. Helluva thing helpin out those kids, Sam.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thank you, but I'm gonna be straight with ya. We're hurtin for money... If we had a little bit more support from people like yourself sure would help things run a lot smoother over there.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Sam, look, everybody is feelin the pinch around here.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I hear that, but you gotta understand that them kids over there got nuthin. I mean nuthin, Bill, and I'm not asking for much.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: How much you lookin for?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Five thousand dollars.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Sam! Five thousand dollars?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That keeps them doors open for another six months. 71

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: People are losin their jobs left and right round here. Tough to be askin for five thousand dollars for a buncha African children half-way around the world.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You're right. We got problems right here. But with that kinda money we could feed them kids, house them kids.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Alright, tell you what, lemme see what I can do.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ok.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Why don't you and the family come over to the house next Sunday. We're havin a little barbeque, ok?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sounds good.

Speaker: shannon
Dialogue: Well, come on in...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I'm Lynn, this here is Sam, our daughter Paige.

Speaker: shannon
Dialogue: Good to meet you.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Glad ya'll could make it. Get on in here and meet some people...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Thank you, Bill.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: Forget it. Now c'mon, can I get ya a mojito or somethin?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Why we leavin so soon?

Speaker: shannon
Dialogue: Everything alright?...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Get in the car.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sonuvabitch is cryin pour-mouth to me and he's livin in the damn Taj Mahal...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I asked him for five-thousand dollars to feed a buncha motherless babies and you know what he gave me?  Hundred and fifty bucks. That's it. Handed it to me like it was gold bouillon! Sonuvabitch spent more than that on salsa for his party.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: What are you doin?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I've had it with these people and all their bullshit about wantin to help...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Sam Childers... 74

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Stay outta my way.

Speaker: shop owner
Dialogue: ... I'm sorry, twenty-five hundred is the best I can do for them gun.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Throw in the car for five.

Speaker: nineteen
Dialogue: It's Garang! -- It's Garang! --

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Who's this guy?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: That's our leader.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: John Garang?

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: They call you Preacher. Is this what I should call you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sam is fine.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: I hear what you have done for the SPLA and I am grateful.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We can thank God for his blessins.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: Yes, we can. How many children do you look after, Sam?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Couple hundred with us here. Feed another thousand a day from nearby villages. Anyone who shows up hungry gets a meal.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: What you are doing is noble, but too dangerous. I must advise you to stop risking your life in our struggle. 76

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Until someone starts fightin for these children, I'm the one that's gonna do it.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: You are stubborn, aren't you?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: As a mule.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: You and I come from very different worlds, but we are not so dissimilar.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Talkin bout peace in a room somewhere is a waste of time. You gotta go out and make it.

Speaker: garang
Dialogue: You are correct, but we must fight them at every level. Part of my battle is waged in those rooms. We must talk of peace, but keep our rifles ready for war.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: You say prayers or somethin?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Already did.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ok then, sweet dreams.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Ain't you gonna read me a book?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ahh, Paige, you know I don't read so good.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Then let's play a game.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ok.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: I'm thinkin of a dog.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: What about it?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Never mind, Donnie.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ok. 78

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Dad usually kisses me on the forehead before he leaves. You can do that.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Sure I can.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Keep em closed! A little bit more!

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Keep your eyes closed.

Speaker: rose
Dialogue: Michael! Cover your eyes! No peeking!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... keep comin'...

Speaker: betty
Dialogue: Open your eyes!

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Some of the child soldiers say there is a bounty on your life. That Kony is offering money for your nose and ears.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: He ain't the first old-boy who wanted to see my head hanging on his wall. Keep yer soldiers where they're needed. I can take care of myself.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: All we know is that his family was killed and that he and his brother were taken into the LRA.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Where's the brother?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Nobody knows.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hey buddy, you don't wanna play with the other kids?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't see nuthin.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: This is it. 81

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hold on...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Deng, tell camp we're comin back with two. A.J., Nineteen -- go get them kids.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's he sayin?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: A.J. is dead.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Shit.  Tell him to stay where he is. Don't move.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Don't move!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ask him if he saw the shooter.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Did you see him?!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You got `em?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Yes. He's on the ridge... just below that outcropping.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Can you reach the Browning?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: I think you got him!

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: It is ok. You can get up now. 84

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Sam, it's me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Everybody ok?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Oh yeah, everybody's just fine. I was just callin to say `hey' is all.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: How're the girls? 85

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: They're good. Paige cooked us all dinner the other night. Chocolate-chip pancakes.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: By herself, huh?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Yep. I helped her with the stove is all. She did everything else. Pretty good too.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Goin fine.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Hey, maybe I'll come with you one of these trips. I'd like to get outta here for a spell. See what it's like.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Sounds good.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ask you a question?

Speaker: sam's voice
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: donnie's voice
Dialogue: You think God will forgive us for the things we've done?

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: In the camps. The children. They say there is a white preacher who hunts the LRA. This place does not need more killing, Mr. Childers.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm just tryin to help these people. Same as you.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: War upon war does not fix what is broken here. The history of this country is filled with righteous killers. That is how it always begins, with men thinking they are killing for the right reasons.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I got a 200 kids who are gonna sleep safe tonight and wake up tomorrow mornin to a bowl of hot food. Right or not, that's all the reason I need.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: And what about the rumors I have heard about you supplying weapons to the SPLA?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You fight the evil in this place your way, I'll fight it mine.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: Do not delude yourself, Mr. Childers. You're a mercenary, not a humanitarian.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's goin on?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: An LRA convoy has moved north over the border. They're heading for Ed Duim.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: That's where they sell em on the black market, ain't it?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Look...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Let's go!

Speaker: nineteen
Dialogue: Clear!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Bring me a flashlight.

Speaker: marco
Dialogue: The front axle is broken... this truck won't drive.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What'd he say?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: The truck is too damaged to move.  We don't have room for them all, Preacher.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Bring our truck up here and shine them lights on us.  Pull everyone of them kids outta there.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Bring the children out...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Put em right here... real easy...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Put them together here... gently... 90

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: We're takin the ones that ain't gonna make it through the night. Come back for the others later.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: It's ok... he will not hurt you...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Put her in the truck.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: We will be back for you!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Let's go!  Two hours... I'll be back in two hours...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Hide until we return!

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Gas it up! We're leavin here in five!

Speaker: customs officer
Dialogue: Sudan?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Sorry I'm late. Sixteen was all jammed up...

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: I understand what you're saying, but there's just not a lot we can do, until we pay down some of what you owe my hands are tied.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's just an application for a short term loan.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Sam, we already took out a second on your home.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's only 90 days.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: You're completely leveraged.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I only got one truck over there, John. I need the money to buy a second vehicle.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's important. Now, there's one in Kampala I can probably get for twenty- one...

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Sam, we know what you're doing over there in Africa and we support it but ...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I want you to look at this. See that? Twelve year old boy had both his arms cut off by LRA...

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Sam... It's not necessary. 94

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Look at this John, when we found this little girl her breasts had been hacked off...

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Sam, this isn't necessary...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Look at her. Look at this girl.

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: I do, but...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: But nuthin. I need you to open yer little book there and do whatever you need to do to get me that loan...

Speaker: bank manager
Dialogue: Sam, You need to calm down...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't tell me to calm down! Look at those pictures! -- Look at em, John --

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... Open yer eyes!... Wake up!...  But God don't want sheep. He wants wolves to fight his fight. Men and women with teeth to tear at the evil that's out there...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... WHO KNOW THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A STICK AND A SWORD AND AIN'T AFRAID TO PICK UP EITHER IF THEY NEED TO!...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... DRAWING UP BATTLE LINES AGAINST HIS ENEMY WHEREVER THEY MAY BE...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... UNTIL THE LEGIONS AGAINST THEM FALL AND ONCE AGAIN THERE IS ONLY HIS LIGHT...

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Mary Strauss and them is havin dinner at The Chimney.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Who's her date?

Speaker: paige's friend
Dialogue: Tony Wilks.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: I thought Tony Wilkes was goin with Patty Hobbes' daughter.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: They broke up last month.

Speaker: tv newscaster
Dialogue: ... Sudanese opposition leader John Garang has been killed in a helicopter crash according to a statement released by the Sudanese Government in Khartoum today.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Honey, you ok?

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Heck, why don't I just drive ya'll?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: We ain't crammin in the back of your Caprice.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Ya'll could fit in there easy.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: We got dresses, Donnie! We'll get all wrinkled! Plus it smells in there.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: I can get some freshener, Paige, that ain't no problem.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Dad, what you think? Can we get a limo? 98

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Dad. Please. Patty and them is gettin one.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You ain't rentin no limo to Pittsburgh.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We could probably get us a deal through one of Tom Hickey's boys. Between the six of them it wouldn't cost too much.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Nobody's spendin money on no friggin limousine.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: But dad...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: WHAT THE HELL DID I JUST SAY?!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: We're just talkin bout it, honey...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Too much talk in this house. I got mouths to feed and you're talkin bout pissing money away on a limo.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: It's my formal, dad.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't give a shit what it is! You ain't gettin no limo, end of story.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You love them black babies more than you love me.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: WATCH YER MOUTH LITTLE GIRL, BEFORE I SLAP IT! 99

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Hey...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What the hell you think you're doin, boy?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Honey...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: SHUT THE FUCK UP!

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Take it easy, buddy.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Don't tell me to take it easy in my own fuckin house...

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: You don't mean that...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Hell I don't. Now you get the fuck outta here fore I put yer head through that wall.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: Yep, you him. I seen your face in the papers few years ago. Call you the Machinegun Preacher, right?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You don't mind, I'd like to just sit here right now.

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: You still helpin them niggers over there?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You're gonna sit there and you're gonna lemme talk.

Speaker: recorded message
Dialogue: This here's Sam. You know what to do.

Speaker: donnie
Dialogue: Hey buddy, it's Donnie. Shoot, I was hopin' you was there...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Most of you want me to stand up here and make some sense outta this. That's why you come here today. You want me to tell you that God has his plan for all of us, and when he wants to call us back home he's gonna do it.  That's what you wanna hear... 103

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Mom, who are those men?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: S'cuse me, what are you doing?

Speaker: mover
Dialogue: Loadin up...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Hey, s'cuse me...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ain't ours no more. Best go through and make sure they ain't takin nuthin that belongs in the house. 104

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Sam...

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Sam!

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Honey, I know you're hurtin. I know you're angry, but we need to talk about this...

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: It's all done, so save yer breath... where's the keys to the safe?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You sold the business for $27,000?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I need a new truck for the orphanage.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: A new truck? You sold our business for a new truck?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What's the combination? What's the fucking combination.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Paige's birthday.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What are the numbers?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: You fight for everyone but us.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You can make it up with the ministry.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: What ministry?! They see what you've become, Sam. They see how far gone you are. You need to get quiet with The Lord.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Fuck the Lord.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Don't say that. Don't turn yer back on him.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: ... He turned his back on me! -- on Donnie! -- on every one of them kids over there.

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: The good you're doin is destroyin this family. 106

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What good have I ever done?

Speaker: lynn
Dialogue: Please don't leave...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Welcome back.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: STOP THE TRUCK! -- STOP!! -- 107

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: WE ARE GOING TO DIE! -- THEY WILL KILL US!

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: You move and they'll shoot! -- calm down! -- I will talk to them.

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: It's ok -- we are a relief convoy --

Speaker: driver
Dialogue: PLEASE DON'T KILL US!

Speaker: agnete
Dialogue: We are only a relief convoy --

Speaker: lra leader
Dialogue: Shut your mouth! 108

Speaker: william
Dialogue: I want to ask you something...

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Do you hear that, Preacher?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: There is no more laughter. The children do not play here anymore. They are scared once again.  But now they are scared of you.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I don't need your help.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: I remember my parents when I sleep. I see them in my dreams sometimes.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Bug? You there?

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: Dad?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Yeah, it's me.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You ok?

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: I'm ok, Bug.

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: You said tree... I'm thinkin of a knee.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: You said knee, I'm thinkin of bee...  I love you, Bug. 112

Speaker: paige
Dialogue: I love you too, Daddy.

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Excuse me...

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Is it true an LRA commander was captured last night?

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Are you going there? 113

Speaker: william
Dialogue: Can I ride with you?

Speaker: william
Dialogue: I want to ask the commander something.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Have you seen William?

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: Some of the soldiers said he was asking about the commander that is being held at Kismoro.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Get em on the phone, see if he's shown up at the base yet.

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: He ran from us.

Speaker: commander
Dialogue: He is worth nothing with no feet. Put him with the others until tomorrow.

Speaker: deng
Dialogue: They have not see the boy.

Speaker: sam
Dialogue: Ok. Get Nineteen and Marco -- we're gonna go look for him.
